head.title: Soviet Republic Rejects Move By Armenian Area to Secede

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/World/Countries and Territories/Russia and the Former Soviet Union

hedline.hl1: Soviet Republic Rejects Move By Armenian Area to Secede

block.p: LEAD: Azerbaijan has rejected an attempt by a predominantly Armenian enclave to secede and join Armenia, the Soviet press agency Tass reported today. The action deepens the stalemate in a territorial dispute that has caused months of ethnic turmoil in the southern Soviet republics.

LEAD: Azerbaijan has rejected an attempt by a predominantly Armenian enclave to secede and join Armenia, the Soviet press agency Tass reported today. The action deepens the stalemate in a territorial dispute that has caused months of ethnic turmoil in the southern Soviet republics.

Azerbaijan has rejected an attempt by a predominantly Armenian enclave to secede and join Armenia, the Soviet press agency Tass reported today. The action deepens the stalemate in a territorial dispute that has caused months of ethnic turmoil in the southern Soviet republics.

Tass said the Presidium of Azerbaijan's Supreme Soviet, or nominal parliament, met in Baku on Tuesday night and declared ''null and void'' the secession declaration that the regional legislature of Nagorno-Karabakh had approved earlier in the day.
